@graph.name: The Kitchen Magpie
@graph.description: Trusted Recipes from my Prairie Kitchen!

@graph.name: Classic Apple Pie - The Kitchen Magpie
@graph.description: Nothing beats a classic apple pie bursting with sweet cinnamon apple filling that is sandwiched between two perfectly flakey pie crusts!

@graph.name: Karlynn Johnston
@graph.description: I’m a busy mom of two, wife & cookbook author who loves creating fast, fresh meals for my little family on the Canadian prairies. Karlynn Facts: I'm allergic to broccoli. I've never met a cocktail that I didn't like. I would rather burn down my house than clean it. Most of all, I love helping YOU get dinner ready because there's nothing more important than connecting with our loved ones around the dinner table!

@graph.name: Classic Apple Pie
@graph.description: Nothing beats a classic apple pie bursting with sweet cinnamon apple filling that is sandwiched between two perfectly flakey pie crusts!
recipeIngredient: 8-10    tart baking apples (Peeled, cored and thinly sliced (6-7 cups))

recipeInstructions.text: Take one pie crust and roll it out a little and fit it into the pie plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Take one pie crust and roll it out a little and fit it into the pie plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the flour, cinnamon and salt together in a small bowl and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk the flour, cinnamon and salt together in a small bowl and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the apples, peel, core and thinly slice into a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash the apples, peel, core and thinly slice into a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the lemon juice to the apples and toss to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the lemon juice to the apples and toss to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sugars to the apples and toss to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sugars to the apples and toss to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add flour/sugar mixture to the apples and toss to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add flour/sugar mixture to the apples and toss to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the apple mixture into the uncooked pie crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the apple mixture into the uncooked pie crust.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the butter pieces all over the top of the apples in the pie crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the butter pieces all over the top of the apples in the pie crust.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll out the second pie crust and place over the top of the apples.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out the second pie crust and place over the top of the apples.

recipeInstructions.text: Crimp the edges of the crusts together and decorate if you want.
recipeInstructions.name: Crimp the edges of the crusts together and decorate if you want.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the 450°F oven for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the 450°F oven for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Lower the oven temperature to 350 °F and bake for another 30-40 minutes. Watch the pie crust carefully and cover the crust with the foil if it gets too dark.
recipeInstructions.name: Lower the oven temperature to 350 °F and bake for another 30-40 minutes. Watch the pie crust carefully and cover the crust with the foil if it gets too dark.

recipeInstructions.text: The pie is done when it's bubbling through the top,the apples are soft, and the crust is brown.
recipeInstructions.name: The pie is done when it's bubbling through the top,the apples are soft, and the crust is brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove and cool on the counter.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove and cool on the counter.
